overview: First cases of pneumonia of unknown cause reported in Wuhan, China.
furtherDescription: Chinese authorities notified the World Health Organization (WHO) of several pneumonia cases in Wuhan, Hubei Province. The cause was later identified as a novel coronavirus.

overview: WHO declares a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
furtherDescription: The WHO issued its highest alert level, acknowledging the international spread of COVID-19 and urging coordinated global action.

overview: First confirmed COVID-19 death outside China in the Philippines.
furtherDescription: A 44-year-old man in the Philippines became the first recorded COVID-19 fatality outside China, highlighting global spread concerns.

overview: WHO declares COVID-19 a global pandemic.
furtherDescription: The WHO officially characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic, acknowledging sustained global transmission and the need for urgent containment measures.

overview: Global lockdowns and travel restrictions implemented.
furtherDescription: Many countries introduced strict lockdowns and border closures to contain the virus, drastically reducing global mobility and economic activity.

overview: Development and trials of COVID-19 vaccines begin worldwide.
furtherDescription: Pharmaceutical companies and research institutions launched large-scale vaccine trials, with mRNA technology showing early promise.

overview: First COVID-19 vaccine approved for emergency use in the UK (Pfizer-BioNTech).
furtherDescription: The UK became the first country to approve an mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use, marking a major milestone in the pandemic response.
Countries rolled out mass vaccination programs, though disparities in access between high- and low-income nations became apparent.

overview: Emergence of the Delta and Omicron variants.
furtherDescription: New, more transmissible variants of SARS-CoV-2 drove fresh waves of infection, challenging global vaccination efforts.

overview: WHO declares end of COVID-19 as a global public health emergency.
furtherDescription: After more than three years, the WHO declared the COVID-19 emergency phase over, citing widespread immunity and reduced mortality.
